gloria.CalendricData#

class gloria.CalendricData(*, country=None, subdiv=None, holiday_prior_scale=None, holiday_event=BoxCar(width=Timedelta('1 days 00:00:00')), seasonality_prior_scale=None, yearly_seasonality='auto', quarterly_seasonality=False, monthly_seasonality=False, weekly_seasonality='auto', daily_seasonality='auto')[source]#

Manage calendar-driven seasonal cycles and public-holiday effects for a Gloria forecaster.

The protocol contributes:

  • Seasonalities - yearly, quarterly, monthly, weekly, and daily terms.

  • Holidays - Event regressors for every public holiday in country and (optionally) subdiv.

Parameters:

  • country (str | None) – Two-letter ISO ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country (e.g. "US", "DE"). If None (default), no holiday regressors are created.

  • subdiv (str | None) – An optional ISO 3166-2 subdivion code (e.g. state, province etc.). If None, only nationwide holidays are considered.

  • holiday_prior_scale (float | None) – Parameter modulating the strength of all holiday regressors. Larger values allow the model to fit larger holiday impact, smaller values dampen the impact. Must be larger than 0. If None (default), the forecaster’s event_prior_scale is used.

  • holiday_event (Event) – Event object that defines the temporal shape of each holiday regressor. The default is a one-day BoxCar event replicating Prophet- style holiday regressors.

  • seasonality_prior_scale (float | None) – Global strength parameter for every seasonality added by the protocol. Larger values permit stronger seasonal variation, smaller values dampen it. Must be larger than 0.If None (default), the forecaster’s seasonality_prior_scale is used.

  • yearly_seasonality (bool | int | "auto") – Configures how to add the respective seasonality to the model. Details see below.

  • quarterly_seasonality (bool | int | "auto") – Configures how to add the respective seasonality to the model. Details see below.

  • monthly_seasonality (bool | int | "auto") – Configures how to add the respective seasonality to the model. Details see below.

  • weekly_seasonality (bool | int | "auto") – Configures how to add the respective seasonality to the model. Details see below.

  • daily_seasonality (bool | int | "auto") – Configures how to add the respective seasonality to the model. Details see below.

Seasonality Options

The behaviour of the seasonal components is controlled by the yearly_seasonality, quarterly_seasonality, monthly_seasonality, weekly_seasonality, and daily_seasonality parameters. Valid values are:

  • True: add the seasonality with the default maximum Fourier order (see table below).

  • False: do not add the seasonality.

  • "auto": add the seasonality if the data span at least two full cycles. Choose the smaller of the default order and the highest order allowed by the Nyquist theorem as maximum order.

  • integer >= 1: add the seasonality with that integer as the maximum order.

Default Maximum Orders

Name

Period

Default Order

yearly

365.25 d

10

quarterly

91.31 d

2

monthly

30.44 d

3

weekly

7 d

3

daily

1 d

4

Note on Quarterly Seasonality

The quarterly component is a strict subset of the yearly component. It is therefore automatically disabled if the yearly seasonality is enabled, overriding the setting of quarterly_seasonality.

Methods

classmethod from_dict(protocol_dict)[source]#

Creates CalendricData protocol from a dictionary.

The key-value pairs of the dictionary must correspond to the constructor arguments of the protocol.

Parameters:

protocol_dict (dict[str, Any]) – Dictionary containing all protocol fields

Returns:

CalendricData protocol object with fields from protocol_dict

Return type:

CalendricData

set_events(model, timestamps)[source]#

Adds all holidays for specified country and subdivision to the Gloria object.

Only holidays whose dates fall within the span covered by timestamps are added; all others are ignored.

Note

You may call set_events() directly to add the holidays. When the protocol is registered via Gloria.add_protocol(), however, it is invoked automatically during Gloria.fit(), so an explicit call is rarely required.

Parameters:

  • model (Gloria) – The Gloria model to be updated

  • timestamps (pandas.Series) – A Series of pandas.Timestamp. Only holidays within the range set by timestamps will be added to the model.

  • self (Self)

Returns:

The updated Gloria model.

Return type:

Gloria

set_seasonalities(model, timestamps)[source]#

Adds yearly, quarterly, monthly, weekly, daily seasonalities to the Gloria object.

The ruleset whether and how to add each seasonality is described in the CalendricData constructor in detail.

Note

You may call set_seasonalities() directly to add the features. When the protocol is registered via Gloria.add_protocol(), however, it is invoked automatically during Gloria.fit(), so an explicit call is rarely required.

Parameters:

  • model (Gloria) – The Gloria model to be updated

  • timestamps (pandas.Series) – A Series of pandas.Timestamp.

  • self (Self)

Returns:

The updated Gloria model.

Return type:

Gloria
